title: Phi4tech: Extremadura will Host First Battery Cell Factory in South Europe, Investment of 400 M EUR and 500 Jobs
notes:
Location:
- The battery cell factory project is located in the Southwest European Logistics Platform, in Badajoz, Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The planned investment for the project is 400 million euros, with the creation of 200 jobs in the first phase and 500 jobs at maximum production.

Investment amounts:
- The total estimated investment for the comprehensive energy storage project, including the battery cell factory, lithium extraction, and other related initiatives, is over 1,000 million euros. The battery and cathode factories are part of a private initiative by Phi4tech and other partners.

Project progress:
- The project has already begun its journey about two years ago and is part of the strategy to accelerate the transformation of the automobile sector in Spain. The presentation of the project took place in Mérida, with the presence of various officials and stakeholders. The lithium mining project in Las Navas is currently in the drafting phase of the exploitation project and restoration plan.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery cell factory, as well as the extraction of lithium and nickel, and the construction of a cathode factory.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers multiple stages of the battery manufacturing value chain, including the extraction of lithium and nickel, as well as the construction of battery and cathode factories.

Note: The information provided does not cover the specific capacity of the battery cell factory or the current operational status.

title: Extremadura will host Phi4tech first battery cell factory in southern Europe
notes:
Location:
- The battery cell factory project is located in the Southwest European Logistics Platform in Badajoz, Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The planned final capacity of the battery cell factory is 10 gigawatts (GW), to be achieved modularly over time in 5 modules of 2GW each. The initial 2GW module is expected to be inaugurated a year and a half after the start of construction, with an investment of about 80 million euros and the creation of 200 direct jobs. The goal is to reach 6GW of production by 2024, and when the maximum capacity of 10GW is reached, a total investment of 400 million euros and around 500 direct employees are anticipated. There is also an option to expand to 20 GWh/year by 2027.

Investment amounts:
- The planned investment for the battery cell factory is 400 million euros, with an additional 200 million euros for the construction of a cathode factory. The total estimated investment for the comprehensive energy storage project, including lithium and nickel extraction, is over 1,000 million euros. The project has received financing and has secured clients.

Project progress:
- The project presentation took place in Mérida, and the next step is to deliver the project plans to the Badajoz City Council to process its urban planning license. It is estimated that machines could start working on the plot by the end of this year or early 2022, with the inauguration of the initial 2GW module expected around the middle of 2023.

Project type:
- The battery cell factory is a new build project.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Additional notes:
- The project is part of a comprehensive energy storage project that includes the extraction of lithium and nickel, as well as the construction of a cathode factory. The project also involves the establishment of the National Energy Storage Center in Cáceres and the implementation of an engineering postgraduate master’s degree at the University of Extremadura.

title: Construction Begins for Spain’s First Major Production Base for Lithium Battery Cells
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Noblejas, a municipality in the province of Toledo, within the autonomous region of Castilla-La Mancha, Spain.

Capacity:
- The production capacity of the Noblejas base is expected to reach 300MWh before the end of this year, and then expand to 2GWh in 2023, 10GWh in 2025, and finally 20GWh in 2027.

Investment amounts:
- The construction of the Noblejas base and cathode production facility in Extremadura will entail a total investment of around €1 billion. Additionally, the development of the two projects is expected to create 1,600 new jobs. 
- Phi4Tech estimates that €400 million will be invested in the construction of the Badajoz base.

Project progress:
- Construction started in June for Spain’s first GW-scale production base for lithium battery cells in Noblejas. The base is scheduled to begin pilot production before the end of this year.
- Phi4Tech and the regional government of Extremadura jointly announced the plan to establish an integrated industry cluster for lithium batteries in March.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with capacity building to be implemented in multiple phases.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode production and battery cell fabrication.

title: Second large battery factory to be built in Extremadura by Acciona and Envision
notes:

- The Extremadura factory will have a capacity of 10 GW with a possibility to expand.

Investment amounts:
- The Extremadura plant will receive a private investment of €800m. The companies hope to obtain public money from the PERTE fund for renewable energies, green hydrogen, and energy storage, which is endowed with €6.9bn.

Project progress:
- The Extremadura factory is in the process of attracting investors and has received a private investment of €800m. It is also seeking public funding from the PERTE fund for renewable energies, green hydrogen, and energy storage.

Project type:

Value chain stages:
- The Extremadura factory will cover multiple value chain stages, including lithium refining, a gigafactory, and industrial elements connecting with the region.

title: Commencement of construction work on our supercapacitor factory in Badajoz
notes:
Location:
The project is located at the Plataforma Logística del Suroeste Europeo (Logistics Platform of Southwest Europe) in Badajoz, Spain.

Capacity:
The plant is expected to produce 600,000 units of energy storage supercapacitors per year and will be operational in early 2025.

Investment amounts:
The total investment in the supercapacitor cell manufacturing plant and the nanomaterials research centre for energy storage is expected to reach €100 million when all expansion phases are fully developed.

Project progress:
Clearance work began on the site in May, and the earthworks and foundations for the construction of both buildings will be carried out. The supercapacitor factory is expected to be operational in early 2025, while the research and development centre for nanomaterials for energy storage will be completed by the end of 2024.

Project type:
The project involves the construction of a new supercapacitor cell manufacturing plant and a nanomaterials research centre for energy storage.

Value chain stages:
The facility will cover the stages of supercapacitor cell manufacturing and nanomaterials research for energy storage.
